review.title: A factorization criterion for acyclic directed mixed graphs
review.abstract: Acyclic directed mixed graphs, also known as semi-Markov models represent the conditional independence structure induced on an observed margin by a DAG model with latent variables. In this paper we present a factorization criterion for these models that is equivalent to the global Markov property given by (the natural extension of) d-separation.

sections.text: Acyclically controlled mixed graphs, also known as semi-Markov models, represent the conditional structure of independence induced by a DAG model with latent variables in an observed margin. In this thesis, we present a factorization criterion for these models that corresponds to the global Markov property given by (the natural extension) of deseparation.
